I.  Introduction 
A.  The Annual Report Period 
1.  This is the sixth Annual Report1 of the Board Compliance Review Committee (BCRC), a 
committee of the Board of Directors (Board) of the Asian Development Bank (ADB). It covers 
the period from 1 November 2008 to 30 April 2010.2  
 
B.  Compliance Review Phase of the ADB Accountability Mechanism 
2.  On  29  May  2003,  the  Board  approved  the  ADB  Accountability  Mechanism3  (the 
Mechanism) and it became effective on 12 December 2003. Under the Compliance Review 
Phase  of  the  Mechanism,  the  BCRC  has  the  following  specific  functions:  (i)  to  clear  the 
proposed terms of reference (TOR) and the time frame for the Compliance Review Panel (CRP) 
to conduct a compliance review authorized by the Board; and (ii) to review the draft reports 
prepared by the CRP to monitor the implementation of any remedial actions approved by the 
Board as a result of a compliance review. The BCRC conducts business pursuant to the 
Operational Procedures of the Board Compliance Review Committee dated 29 March 2004.4 
 
3.  The Secretary of the CRP also performs the functions as the Secretary of the BCRC and 
the Office of the Compliance Review Panel (OCRP) provides secretariat support to the BCRC, 
including (i) assisting the BCRC in carrying out its activities; and (ii) administering the yearly 
operating expenses of the BCRC, if any. 
 
C.  Members 
4.  The BCRC consists of six Board members comprising four regional and two nonregional 
members. The President appoints the BCRC members, in consultation with the Board, and 
designates the BCRC Chair. The BCRC Chairs and members in the period covered by this 
report are shown below:

II.  Activities of the Board Compliance Review Committee 
A.  Meetings 
5.  The BCRC held a formal meeting that was convened on 16 November 2009. 
 
B.  PRC:  Fuzhou  Environmental  Improvement  Project—Request  for  Compliance 
Review 
6.  On 3 June 2009, Mr. Wang Jie Quan and Mr. Xu Qi Long of Fujian Province, People’s 
Republic of China (PRC) filed a request for compliance review in respect of Loan 2176–PRC: 
Fuzhou Environmental Improvement Project. The OCRP registered the request on 5 June 2009 
and  posted  it  on  the  CRP  website.  The  CRP  determined  the  request  to  be  eligible  for 
compliance  review  and  on  24  June  2009  submitted  to  the  Board  its  recommendation  for 
compliance review. The Board authorized the compliance review on 15 July 2009. 
 
7.  On 16 July 2009, the CRP submitted to the BCRC its draft TOR and timeframe for the 
conduct  of  compliance  review,  and  on  29  July  2009,  the  BCRC  approved  the  TOR  and 
timeframe. The CRP is continuing to conduct the compliance review in this matter as at the date 
of this report. 
 
C.  PAK: Chashma Right Bank Irrigation Project (Stage III)—Monitoring Mandate 
8.  The BCRC reviewed the draft fourth monitoring report for the Chashma Right Bank 
Irrigation Project (Stage III) and, following that review, the CRP issued the fourth monitoring 
report on 11 February 2009. Due to security reasons, the CRP was not able to conduct a site 
visit to the project area and its monitoring consisted primarily of a desk review. The fourth 
monitoring report is available on the CRP website. 
 
9.  The CRP has submitted the fifth monitoring report to the BCRC on 18 March 2010 and it 
will be disclosed within the second quarter of 2010. The CRP has recommended that further 
monitoring of the compliance recommendations beyond five years is no longer necessary.

3 
D.  SRI: Southern Transport Development Project—Monitoring 
10.  The BCRC reviewed the third annual monitoring report for this project and, following that 
review, the CRP issued its report on 15 May 2009. The third monitoring report is posted on the 
CRP website. 
 
III.  Budget 
11.  The Board did not allocate any budget to cover BCRC's operating expenses in the 
period covered by this report. The BCRC did not incur any expenses in the period covered by 
this report. 
 
IV.  Looking Forward 
A.  Terms of Reference 
 
12.  The BCRC will continue to discharge its mandate to clear the TOR for any compliance 
review,  and  to  review  any  monitoring  reports  prepared  by  the  CRP  in  relation  to  ADB's 
implementation of remedial compliance action previously recommended by the Board. 
 
B.  Review of the Mechanism 
 
13.  On the issue of the review of the Mechanism, BCRC members have initiated some 
discussions with Management and staff, the scope, methodology and timeline for that review.5 
 
                                                 
5  Subsequent to the date of this report, in May 2010 the President announced at the ADB's 43rd Annual Meeting in 
Tashkent the initiation of the review of the Accountability Mechanism.
